summary: More than white, wheat and rye, there's a glorious world of breads, and for your enjoyment, here's an alphabet of international bread recipes: Aish Merahrah / Bammy / Česnica / Dosa / Eggette / Flatbrød / Green onion pancake / Himbasha / Injera / Johnnycake / Khanom bueang / Lahoh / Mollete / Naan / Obwarzanek krakowski / Potbrood / Qistibi / Rugbrød / Soda bread / Taftan / Unleavened bread / Vienna bread / Watermelon toast / [nothing for X] / Yufka / Zopf . To take away some of the mystery from these links, there are more descriptions (and more recipes, and MORE BREADS) below the break.
title: Alphabet of international bread recipes (around the world a few times)

summary: The Tapestry of the Search for Terrestrial Intelligence : MetaFilter's own moonmilk took a copy of a copy of the audio data on Voyager's Golden Record , and turned it into a 40-meter-long tapestry of human images-as-sound. Watch it all scroll by
title: The Tapestry of the Search for Terrestrial Intelligence

summary: Most of us have shuddered on hearing the sound of our own voice. In fact, not liking the sound of your own voice is so common that there’s a term for it: voice confrontation.
title: Did you know that the human voice is the only pure instrument?
I want to play my NES, but I don't have any software
"If he's so damn ineffable, why doesn't he write his own biography?"

summary: It's sad when a five-year-old dies of cancer, but this is the most fun funeral and obituary you have ever heard of. Garrett Michael Matthias died at age 5 after a nine month battle with cancer, but he's going to have the best funeral ever.
title: "See ya later, suckas! — The Great Garrett Underpants"

summary: Today as I was walking home after my run I saw a large lemon rolling down the hill. It kept rolling for about a quarter mile. And now you can see it, too. [video on twitter]
title: zest for life

summary: Cuts to SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. Formerally food stamps ) hurt small to medium hold farmers and thier customers . SNAP is a boon to rural and urban economies, cuts in the Farm Bill May end that . (Civil Eats) Tens of thousands of people are about to loose access to fresh produce . (Modern Farmer)
title: Farmers on SNAP

summary: Scott Thompson on CODCO, the Hidden Gem of Newfoundland : "One of the first monologues Scott Thompson performed for Kids in the Hall centered on his Canadian identity. 'Americans know as much about Canada as straight people do about gays,' he purred to camera as his foppish alter ego Buddy Cole. So it’s no surprise that one of Thompson’s favorite sketch troupes of all time, CODCO, also reveled in their regional identity."
title: Pleasant priests in conversation

summary:
Papa John has fallen. John Schnatter, aka Papa John, aka Great AllFather John, aka Pepperoni Paterfamilias, has been brought low by a racial slur and graphic descriptions of violence against minorities during a conference call. In his resignation he has sloppily slid away from his pizza empire, like cheese from an ill-baked slice, leaving only the failure-doused crust of what had once been.

Schnatter and his corporation have had a long and storied history of pointless antagonism , horrific racism , consistently terrible politics , and not paying delivery drivers minimum wage .
title: papajohnendammerung

summary: Justice Department reopens Emmett Till's murder case

Inside the Guild Wars 2 meeting that’s shaken gaming [Polygon] “Jessica Price, who was fired by ArenaNet last week for arguing with fans of the company’s Guild Wars 2 MMO, said she feels betrayed by how the company “folded like a cheap card table” when confronted by toxic fandom. In an interview with Polygon, she talked about the meeting in which she was fired, and castigated ArenaNet managers for their “highly unprofessional” reaction to a social media controversy.”
title: ‘No. Not here. Not in my space,’” she said.

summary: "Soros is as comfortable with Wittgenstein as he is with Warren Buffett, which makes him a sui generis figure in American life, someone whose likes we will not see again for quite a while. He is extremely perceptive about the limits of markets and US power in both domestic and international contexts. He is, in short, among the best the meritocracy has produced. It is for this reason that Soros’s failures are so telling; - Daniel Bessner
title: the open society and its enemies

summary: Urban planner Geoff Boeing has calculated some lovely polar histograms of the orientations of American city streets , and further of various cities around the world , along with explanations of the context and methods.
title: City planning history, in histograms
Who's the "Crazy Evil Genius" Behind a Global Racket?

summary: Together, his aptitude and his tastes combine into something one of his editors called “crassmanship”. “When it comes to headlines, as well as the play of stories, Rupert sheds with ease, if not relief, his Oxford prejudices, intellectual pretensions and the mannerisms of his wealth.” The proprietor’s talent is “uniquely geared to attract the lowest common denominator of reader.”
title: The endless reign of Rupert Murdoch

summary: A 'pay your age' discount on stuffed bears has led to shopping chaos. Though standing in line is not normally thought of as a positive experience, for special items, it makes you appreciate it even more. Some queues are even events in and of itself.
title: Build-A-Bear Madness
